headline: Salesforce forecasts $60 billion in revenue by 2030, shares jump
summary:
STORY: Shares of Salesforce jumped as much as eight-and-a-half percent Thursday morning, after the company projected faster revenue growth through the end of the decade‚Äîeasing investor concerns that AI tools were undercutting demand for its software.

The company, led by CEO Marc Benioff, had posted its first revenue decline in nearly three years earlier this year, sparking fears that businesses were shifting budgets away from traditional customer management tools.

That slump had pulled Salesforce's stock down more than 25% in 2025.

But at its Dreamforce event this week, Salesforce unveiled a bullish forecast: more than $60 billion in revenue by 2030. 

That figure excludes its planned $8 billion acquisition of software company Informatica, a deal expected to close in the first half of next year.

The move is aimed at strengthening Salesforce‚Äôs AI capabilities by integrating Informatica‚Äôs data management tools into its cloud services.

Earlier this week, Salesforce expanded partnerships with OpenAI and Anthropic, embedding their advanced AI models into its Agentforce 360 platform.

The company also pledged a $15 billion investment in San Francisco over five years to accelerate AI adoption.

content.title: Salesforce forecasts $60 billion in revenue by 2030, shares jump
content.summary:
STORY: Shares of Salesforce jumped as much as eight-and-a-half percent Thursday morning, after the company projected faster revenue growth through the end of the decade‚Äîeasing investor concerns that AI tools were undercutting demand for its software.

The company, led by CEO Marc Benioff, had posted its first revenue decline in nearly three years earlier this year, sparking fears that businesses were shifting budgets away from traditional customer management tools.

That slump had pulled Salesforce's stock down more than 25% in 2025.

But at its Dreamforce event this week, Salesforce unveiled a bullish forecast: more than $60 billion in revenue by 2030. 

That figure excludes its planned $8 billion acquisition of software company Informatica, a deal expected to close in the first half of next year.

The move is aimed at strengthening Salesforce‚Äôs AI capabilities by integrating Informatica‚Äôs data management tools into its cloud services.

Earlier this week, Salesforce expanded partnerships with OpenAI and Anthropic, embedding their advanced AI models into its Agentforce 360 platform.

The company also pledged a $15 billion investment in San Francisco over five years to accelerate AI adoption.

headline: Salesforce jumps as $60 billion forecast eases revenue growth concerns
summary: The Marc Benioff-led company had posted its first revenue decline in about three years earlier this year, sparking fears that businesses focused on AI investments were cutting back on what has long been essential customer management software.  But the company's better-than-expected forecast of more than $60 billion revenue in 2030 allayed some of those fears.  That forecast, unveiled at the company's Dreamforce event on Wednesday, excluded the boost from its planned $8 billion acquisition of software-maker Informatica.

content.title: Salesforce jumps as $60 billion forecast eases revenue growth concerns
content.summary: The Marc Benioff-led company had posted its first revenue decline in about three years earlier this year, sparking fears that businesses focused on AI investments were cutting back on what has long been essential customer management software.  But the company's better-than-expected forecast of more than $60 billion revenue in 2030 allayed some of those fears.  That forecast, unveiled at the company's Dreamforce event on Wednesday, excluded the boost from its planned $8 billion acquisition of software-maker Informatica.

headline: Forrester Announces Full Conference Agenda And Award Winners For B2B Summit APAC 2025
summary: Forrester (Nasdaq: FORR) today announced the full conference agenda for its B2B Summit APAC 2025, taking place on November 6 in Singapore. The B2B buying landscape is evolving dramatically with buyers choosing to make self-guided purchases from trusted providers. As a result, marketing leaders must think beyond traditional marketing approaches to win, retain, and grow customers.

headline: Salesforce Announces New FY30 Revenue Target of $60B+, 10% Organic FY26-FY30 CAGR
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, October 16, 2025--Salesforce (NYSE: CRM), the world‚Äôs #1 AI CRM, today announced a new long-term revenue target of $60B+ by fiscal year (FY) 2030, excluding Informatica. This implies a 10%+ organic FY26 to FY30 compounded annual growth rate (CAGR). Additionally, Salesforce announced a new long-term Profitable Growth Framework, 50 by FY30, through which the company aims to have the sum of subscription and support constant currency growth rate and non-GAAP operating margin total 50

content.title: Salesforce Announces New FY30 Revenue Target of $60B+, 10% Organic FY26-FY30 CAGR
content.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, October 16, 2025--Salesforce (NYSE: CRM), the world‚Äôs #1 AI CRM, today announced a new long-term revenue target of $60B+ by fiscal year (FY) 2030, excluding Informatica. This implies a 10%+ organic FY26 to FY30 compounded annual growth rate (CAGR). Additionally, Salesforce announced a new long-term Profitable Growth Framework, 50 by FY30, through which the company aims to have the sum of subscription and support constant currency growth rate and non-GAAP operating margin total 50
